application_instruction: Note: By applying to this position your application is automatically submitted to the following locations: Mountain View, CA, USA; San Francisco, CA, USA; Boulder, CO, USA; Chicago, IL, USA; New York, NY, USA
description:
At Google, data drives all of our decision-making, and our HR organization is no exception. The People Analytics team acts as an internal innovation lab, using analytical approaches to make sure Google continues to be a great place to work. The team provides critical support to the business around issues of organizational health and is responsible for not just taking the pulse of our Googlers, but harnessing Googler feedback to drive change for the better. As an analyst you'll be detail-oriented and conscientious, analytical and curious. You're a strong problem-solver, who uses both quantitative and qualitative methods to get things done. And on top of it all, you're someone who wonders "What if?" and then seeks out the solution.

As a Diversity Analyst, you’ll use your analytical, data management, and project management skills while partnering with Google’s Performance Management and Diversity and teams to develop analytics strategy and work on priorities across our initiatives.

Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (you probably know us better as "Human Resources"). Made up of equal parts HR professionals, former consultants and analysts, we're the advocates of Google's colorful culture. In People Ops, we "find them, grow them, and keep them" - we bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next great Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in economics, statistics, finance, psychology, a field that uses quantitative analysis, or equivalent practical experience.
  • Experience manipulating data (e.g., check, clean, merge) with SQL, R, or other statistical languages.
  • Experience in project and relationships management.
  • Experience using quantitative and qualitative research to provide insight, answer questions, and guide solutions.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience with research/experiment methodologies and best practices.
  • Experience designing a data strategy for teams around specific data types.
  • Experience working with diversity data.
  • Experience presenting to technical and non-technical audiences.
responsibilities:
• Combine information from different sources (e.g., spreadsheets, SQL, etc.) to recommend and create complex samples to launch interventions, based on collaboration with program managers on the Performance and Diversity teams.
  • Design and execute on evaluation plans for interventions/pilots, including options for ongoing reporting.
  • Build effective relationships and collaborate across People Operations (POps), including Employee Engagement, Human Resources (People Partners and People Consultants), Legal, and People Development teams.
  • Manipulate and analyze data sets to distill insights to convey findings to executive audiences.
  • Stay productive in an ambiguous, changing work environment, creating structure, applying project management skills, and developing and meeting timelines.
title: Diversity Analyst, Performance Management
